title: Coal Stocks Are Burning Up Again
sub_head: Reversal in once-beleaguered shares might last
body:
Old habits die hard. As the world rekindles its romance with coal after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, investors betting on the dirty fuel are suddenly back in the black.
In the very long run, coal’s prospects still look dim. But a renewed global obsession with energy security combined with cautious investment in coal supply in recent years means that coal prices—and the stock prices of coal diggers—could remain elevated for a while.
